description: By far the best alternative to xournal++, for anyone who is looking for a clean interface
I can see it has great potential but it is still very buggy, please finish the development and I will use it every day, excellent so far, thank you very much :^)
summary: It would be wonderful if it didn't freeze every time I use it

description: Smoother and better organized than it's competition
summary: The best drawing app for gnome

description: It just works fluid on my ThinkPad X12

I used Xournal++ for a long time for taking notes at school with my tablet and stylus. However, this software is all I ever wanted from a notetaking program: It is wonderfully designed in a human-friendly way. The organization of the notebooks is way better and all in all.
Even though this is a relatively new project, it is already very feature-rich. You can even import your "legacy" Xournal++ files.
Beautifully made app!

When first writing down something with the text option the letters are set in bold. You have to select the text back and then click the "backspace" button above the letter styles (bold, italic, underlined) in order to revert the text style to normal. The issue is quite frustrating. And you have to do that each and every time you type something.

The good: It's the best app I've come across that integrates writing and drawing so well and in a simple manner. The option to export your work in a Pdf or a some other file types is just amazing.
unfortunately, it don't really works whit my HP pen.

I think this is the best writting app that is out there. If you think pen support on linux is still bad, then try this app and it will blow your mind. I love everything about this app excpt for it being on flatpak (because I want to use my system theme) but thats okay. Thanks for making the best writting app i've seen!
It's the second release and it already works better than xournalpp, even if it has less features. I have very high hopes for future releases

It is already fantastic, really looking forward to the future releases.

Keep up the good work!
It's look great, but unfortunettly until it gets pen pressure level recognition, xournall++ will be better.
makes me more around the canvas instead of drawing.
Looks much better than Xournal++ and the pen input is much more fluid too, not as laggy as X++
summary: Very nice to use note-taking app

description: I suggest adding more configuration options for tablets. I would also fuse the sidebar workspace/configuration menu with the hamburger menu, makes the hamburger menu less useless
such a great app for taking notes on linux device

Very intuitive to use. 
The drawing is responsive and the curve smoothing is nice. Almost at the level of xournal++
Really like the "expand the sheet vertically" and "expand mode" options.
Would love to see more configurable keyboard shortcuts to switch between pens/colors.
The "temporary eraser" is also nice and I would like to see you be able to change the keybindings (from the GUI)
I would love to see per-shape color mode, where changing the color for rectangle does not change it for the line/triangle etc.
MS Paint for linux with actual good interface.
summary: Good app, GTK4, love to see it!

description: But this application easy to crash, just draw something on the screen, zoom out for maximum value and move panel as fast as you can. In my case there are crashes at 9/10 cases.

It is a pretty, performant handwritten note editor. The core features are easy to find and use. Updates are very frequent at the moment which is a blessing and it's made with GTK4 and Flatpak in mind.

Some little caveats exist, however:
- The settings are a little scattered. For example, I dont see why the document-settings are inside the file explorer, while some layout settings, like whether the document is infinite or finite. If you just want to note things, you'll be fine
- Some bugs are to be expected, and this is alright for such young software. It would be nice if the specific bugs that were fixed were listed in the update notes
- While an autosave feature exists, It would be nice if it would also kick-in for unsaved documents, in case the program/pc crashes. Local temporary files would allow for that. A great example for this is the app Paper
- If a PDF file _alone_ is opened with Rnote, it should be imported at 100% scale

All in all, I love to see the progress this app already has and i will be watching its future, hoping it will replace xournal++ completely for GTK4 users
summary: I'll be watching your career with great interest

description:
Although I would not compare it to a heavy duty application such as Journal++, it is a small, easy, and quick to use vector note app with an open design road for improvement. It is good to have this option as well as others. Itś what makes Linux interesting and useful. The interface needs a bit better organizing, but itś ok because itś developer lets you
know itś a project on the go. They don' t over promise or over state the case for it. Nice going.
summary: More options in Linux is good

description: As other reviews noted, the application has a great focus on user experience and is yet extremely smooth. A support for .xopp Files is great, but it isn't showing smaller strokes. Also at the Moment you can't change the color/size/type of a selected stroke. With additional features and a few bugfixes while remaining compatible to xournal++ this can get great!

There are two other excellent note drawing applications out there in the NguLinux repos, now we have RNote.
They are all pretty good, but this one I have found to be the easiest to use and it happens 
to work with my two drawing tablets very well. Adjustments for shape precision is very straight foward, and other functions are easy to quickly reach through the logically arranged menus. Very well done.
summary: Very good and well organized functionalities

description: Wenn man jetzt noch PDF beschriften kann. Also als Hintergrund einfügen kann, wäre es noch perfekt. Das Einfügen des PDFs so wie es jetzt ist klappt nicht sehr gut. PDF als Hintergrund (wie bei Xournal++) wäre super.

Rnote ist mittlerweile die Hauptanwendung zum Notizenschreiben auf meinem Tablet und hat Xournal++ da schon abgelöst.

Es gibt noch Dinge zu verbessern, wie den Radierer, Undo/Redo sowie eine übersichtlichere UI, es ist schon jetzt eine gute Anwendung!

I has everything it needs for note taking. I'm using this app for university, loading in the Data files and handwriting notes. I'm using a microsoft surface go 3 and an original pen. All functions are working like a charm. Best app i used so far.
Вроде удобное приложение для решения задач, записей. Все что нужно есть, мне нравится.
Very useful! 5 stars for you!
